title: Tasty Tom Rewards Customers
text:
27 August 2015 18:44 CET Tasty Tom Rewards Customers By Daily Guide 
Frank Wilson, Tasty Tom Central Regional Sales Officer, presents a cheque for GH¢5,000 to Faustina Binney, a winner of the Tasty-Tom 'Ma Yente Wonka' Promo at Swedru 
Many people have won several prizes in the ongoing Tasty Tom Tomato Paste promotion in the Northern and Central Regions. 
Several home-makers and young self-employed women have also won cash from the premium tomato brand. 
The Tasty Tom promo, known on the market as ' Ma yente wonka,' was launched two months ago to reward consumers for their loyalty. 
It has offered a variety of exciting prizes redeemable instantly and digitally by phone. 
Faustina Binney, a 30-year-old chop bar operator at Agona Swedru, who won GH¢5,000, told reporters that she has never dreamt of ever touching that kind of money in her life, much less owning it. 
She was full of praise for the management of Tasty-Tom Tomato Paste for the simplicity of the promotion and the credible manner in which it is being run. 
Regina Aidoo, a resident of Mamprobi, was elated when she opened a tin of Tasty Tom tomato paste and found that she had won GH¢10,000. 
At Tamale, Apiphemai Allotey, a 36-year-old food vendor at Vittin Police Barrier, also won GH¢1,000. 
Dinah Adu-Asare, Brand Manger of Tasty Tom Tomato Paste said, 'This promotion is based on our understanding of the importance of the Ghanaian family system and how Ghanaians generally like to stay connected to their loved ones. That's why the promo does not only reward our consumers for their loyalty but also helps them communicate and stay connected to those who matter to them.' 
Consumers win instantly if they text correctly to the shortcode 1942. 
'We are not only excited about this promotion because of its uniqueness and simplicity from other promotions in the category but also delighted about the life-changing testimonials from some of these winners,' said Ms Adu-Asare. 
The Tasty Tom 'Ma Yente Wonka' promotion will run until the end of October. 
A Business Desk Report
